com.rivelbop.rivelworks.util

Class CameraShaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rivelbop.rivelworks.util.CameraShaker

  • public class CameraShaker
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0.0 November 2022 See https://github.com/antzGames/libGDX-cameraShake for more information.

    Loosely based on 'Mastering LibGDX Game Development' - Chapter 9 - Camera Shake Book: https://www.amazon.com/Mastering-LibGDX-Game-Development-Patrick/dp/1785289365

    Changes/Enhancements: - All variables now use Vector3 (for eventual 3-axis camera shaking) - Minimum shake radius is now configurable - Radius fall off factor (was hard coded to 0.9f) is now configurable - added validation checks to parameters - You need to pass the camera in constructor, instead of position.x/y - added update() method for updating camera position - only compute new shake camera position every 1/60th of a second at most to accommodate fast refresh rates (to save GPU cycles) - added resetAndReconfigure(...) method to allow parameter changes - renamed variables so to not look like python

    Author:
    antz

    • Constructor Detail

      • CameraShaker

        public CameraShaker(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera camera,
                    float shakeRadius,
                    float minimumShakeRadius,
                    float radiusFallOffFactor)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        camera - supports any camera implementation
        shakeRadius - original was set to 30.0f, must be greater than 0
        minimumShakeRadius - original was set to 2.0f, must be greater than 0 and less than shakeRadius
        radiusFallOffFactor - original was set to 0.9f, must be greater than 0 and less than 1

      • CameraShaker

        public CameraShaker(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera camera)
        Constructor - simple version

        Use this constructor to create a camera shaker with default values

        shakeRadius = 30f; // must be positive minimumShakeRadius = 3f; // must be positive and less than shakeRadius, aim for 5-15% of shake radius radiusFallOffFactor = 0.90f; // must be greater than 0 and less than 1

        Parameters:
        camera - supports any camera implementation

    • Method Detail

      • startShaking

        public void startShaking()
        Call this after a player collision/impact/explosion to start the camera shaking.

      • update

        public void update(float delta)
        Always call this in your game's main update/render method.

        Make sure batch.setProjectionMatrix(camera.combined) is set prior to call.

        Parameters:
        delta - DeltaTime used to update camera properly.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Called by diminishShake() when minimum shake radius reached.

        But you can also stop a camera shake by calling this method if needed.

      • resetAndReconfigure

        public void resetAndReconfigure(float shakeRadius,
                                float minimumShakeRadius,
                                float radiusFallOffFactor)
        This allows to reconfigure parameters. Check if not shaking before calling, or else current shake will end.
        Parameters:
        shakeRadius - original was set to 30.0f, must be greater than 0
        minimumShakeRadius - original was set to 2.0f, must be greater than 0 and less than shakeRadius
        radiusFallOffFactor - original was set to 0.9f, must be greater than 0 and less than 1

      • isCameraShaking

        public boolean isCameraShaking()
        You can check if camera is currently shaking.
        Returns:
        is the camera currently shaking.
